title: BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood issues stern warning about wearing green on screen

Former Strictly Come Dancing star and weather presenter Carol Kirkwood has taken to social media to laugh about disappearing into the green screen behind her while live on air.

Green screen is used behind presenters to show a map of the UK so that they can point to different areas as they speak.

Carol, who presents weather forecasts for the BBC, was wearing a green dress which made her body become part of the map.

Appearing as a floating head, Carol laughed: "And this is why we don't wear green against a green screen!

"You look like you've just got hands, it's very Halloween-y. Now, when I change the background...ah!"

(Image: Twitter)

(Image: Twitter)

Carol's lime green dress, along with her torso, appears on the screen.

Carol posted the clip to her 164,000 followers with the caption "This is why we don't wear green in front of the green screen xxx" along with a string of cry laugh emojis.

Appearing in the 2015 edition of Strictly, Carol was paired with the hunky pro Pasha Kovalev.

(Image: PA)

Despite, finishing tenth, she seems to have enjoyed the experience and reflected on it co-hosts Dan walker and Louise Minchin.

"Carol, how many years is it now since you did Strictly?" Dan asked.

"Four," she laughed.

When Dan asked if she had any fond memories, Carol beamed: "Yes! You know I'll never forget it and I'll never regret."

She's set a trend of broadcasters turning their eyes on the dance floor, as sports presenter Mike Bushell is currently locked in a struggle for survival in Strictly's 17th series.

Mike survived a dance off with former England goalkeeper David James at the weekend by the skin of his teeth, and some fans reckon he'll get the boot this Sunday.
description: Carol was wearing a green dress which made her body blend into the green screen map of the UK behind her
